body:
There's one weird thing with this. When copying shortcuts, rclone counts as if copying the file (if the file is 10gb, but it's just a shortcut, it creates a new shortcut, but it counts as if it's transfered 10gb).

It would be amazing to be able to actually copy the file and not the shortcut. I'm trying to copy a bunch of files that are linked with shortcuts to another drive which I do not own, and I can't do that. I have to copy them by hand, more than 2 thousand files.
This probably wouldn't be too hard if you wanted to have a go @LaazV ?

This will be great. I have the same problem when doing server side copy, whenever is a folder it copies the folder and its content but when it's a file it just copy the shortcut. I try put all the shortcut files in a folder and well, it didn't work. I know that's how it should work according the documentation, but it you can make it to copy files instead of shorcuts will be really good!

issue.title: s3: multipart upload for an object,  can not use 'md5' to compare the object?

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: @ncw @ivandeex If the object was uploaded with multipart, the md5 is not same.

body: doesn't this already happen, I can recount multiple times when I've only had a shortcut to the files and files on another drive but was able to copy the files completely.
@abhiraj2 this is talking specifically about server side copies - I expect you were doing a non server side copy.

Correct, I used it for non-server side copy
How would one go about implementing it for server side copies?

> Correct, I used it for non-server side copy How would one go about implementing it for server side copies?

It would need a feature flag `--drive-copy-shortcut-contents` (say)  and a bit of code modification. Instead of calling `shortcutID(srcObj.id)` this bit of code would call `actualID(srcObj.id)` if the flag was set. I think that is enough.

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/c26dc69e1b42e2b4ca1f845cb9682bc432366bf4/backend/drive/drive.go#L2377-L2378
Alright I'll give it a go

issue.title: drive: added --drive-copy-shortcut-content, fixes #4604

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->
Added --drive-copy-shortcut-content flag, that enables the user to copy the content of shortcuts when performing server side transfer.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->
#4604
